inputs.selection_motivation: Euribor is the benchmark short‑term eurozone rate; when it rises relative to US rates it signals higher euro rates, which typically weakens the DXY. This causal path is a primary driver of the USD‑euro exchange rate.
inputs.candidate_motivation: Euribor is a eurozone short‑term rate benchmark, directly driven by ECB policy and euro‑area inflation, and closely linked to euro‑bond yields. It also moves in tandem with global short‑term rates (Fed policy, US 2Y/10Y yields) and influences the euro’s value against major currencies, so related FX and US macro indicators are strong peers or correlates.

proposed_link.motivation: Euribor is the benchmark short‑term eurozone rate; when it rises relative to US rates it signals higher euro rates, which typically weakens the DXY. This causal path is a primary driver of the USD‑euro exchange rate.
